intro: Glochidion zeylanicum var. malayanum, commonly known as the Malayan glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has simple, opposite, and often pubescent leaves that are usually elliptical to ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, with both male and female flowers occurring on the same inflorescence. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, facilitating wind dispersal.
